|flash1type = SPI |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = GigaDevice;GD25Q80BSIG; |flash1size = 1 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->

|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "04220B" is silkscreened on the board. This is confirmed to be a [[Zioncom]] IP04220.
:;Firmware releases: Firmware 1.4 and lower should ''NOT'' be used due to a [https://pierrekim.github.io/blog/2015-07-16-4-TOTOLINK-products-vulnerable-to-CSRF-and-XSS-attacks.html vulnerability] found on this device.
* [https://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=0B9qpIP95EuK4dG5NZ1ViRm82SWs TOTOLINK-N200RE-IP04220-MT7620-SPI-1M8M-V1.4_B20140116_1_364_EN] * [https://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=0B9qpIP95EuK4VmJtTkhESEhZd0k TOTOLINK-N200RE-IP04220-MT7620-SPI-1M8M-V1.4-B20140724-2-457-EN] * [https://drivers.softpedia.com/get/Router-Switch-Access-Point/TOTOLINK/TOTOLINK-N200RE-V1-Router-Firmware-15020150725.shtml TOTOLINK-N200RE-IP04220-MT7620-SPI-1M8M-V1.5-B20150724-1-457-EN]
Firmware files of this device are discontinued on the official site. :It is instead found on preservation sites such as Softpedia.
:;Serial There is a populated and marked serial port header on the board. :Pinout for the serial port (header J2) is marked - [Vcc] [Tx] [Rx] [GND] :- from the orientation found on top of the board.
:;Rebrands/Variations of the Zioncom IP04220 OEM router: * [[TOTOLINK]] N200RE V1 - IP04220 (MT7620N) - Released on May 29, 2013 * ''CD-R KING'' WR-NET-024-ZI (IP04220) - Released on June 6, 2013 ::The CD-R King variant's default SSID is not uniform. It's the brand name & the last 3 octets of the MAC address '''"CD-R KING_''MAC SN''"'''. ::Top shell of the N200RE is altered with the CD-R King variant ::A CD-R King 5db antenna variation has been implemented on this version. {{See also|CD-R KING CW-5356U}}
Zioncom IP04220 firmware differences between variations :Brand images and a few details are different while everything else is the same. :You can upgrade from the customized CD-R KING OS V1.4 to TOTOLINK's V1.5 variant (Tested and confirmed to be much more stable/secure).
:;Price Range :The Philippine variant "CD-R King" released this device with a 680 PHP price tag.
:;References: :[http://3a.com.vn/bo-phat-wifi/bo-phat-song-wifi-cong-suat-lon-cho-toa-nha-chuan-n-300-mbps-totolink-n200re.html '''''TOTOLINK N200RE V1.4''''' on '''''3A store page'''''] :[http://3a.com.vn/Images/image/a6/netcomputer/bo-phat-wifi-2-rau-300-mbps-totolink_n200re-3a-2.jpg '''''TOTOLINK N200RE V1.4 Box Art''''' on '''''3A store page'''''] :[http://3a.com.vn/Images/image/a6/netcomputer/bo-phat-wifi-2-rau-300-mbps-totolink_n200re-3a-1.jpg '''''TOTOLINK N200RE V1.4 Product Preview''''' on '''''3A Store page''''] :[https://setuprouter.com/router/totolink/n200re/screenshots.htm '''''TOTOLINK N200RE V1.4 User Interface''''' on '''''SetupRouter.com''''']
